stem: A 19-year-old male with a history of blunt chest trauma is gasping for air. Based on the provided information, select the most likely condition, two appropriate nursing actions, and two essential parameters to monitor.

tabs.title: SBAR
tabs.content:
Situation: Acute respiratory failure and hemodynamic collapse.
Background: Motor vehicle accident (MVA) with steering wheel impact 2 hours prior. Rib fractures noted on admission.
Assessment: Severe respiratory distress; jugular venous distention (JVD) present.
Recommendation: Immediate decompression.

tabs.title: Thoracic Imaging & Airway Alignment
tabs.content:
Assessment ItemFindingClinical Indication
Breath SoundsAbsent on Right; Hyper-resonant to percussionAir trapped in pleural space
Tracheal PositionDeviated to the LEFTLate sign of tension pneumothorax
Chest X-ray (Bedside)Right-sided lung collapse; Mediastinal shiftTension Pneumothorax
Venous StatusDistended Neck Veins (JVD)Obstructive Shock component

tabs.title: Vital Signs
tabs.content: BP 78/40 mmHg, HR 148 bpm, RR 36 breaths/min, SpO2 76% on room air (rapidly decreasing).

actionOptions.text: Administer IV Heparin bolus as prescribed
Assess for Homan's sign in lower extremities

parameterOptions.text: Presence of a friction rub on cardiac auscultation

rationale.correct: Tension Pneumothorax (c2) is a life-threatening emergency where trapped air increases pressure, causing JVD, tracheal deviation, and cardiovascular collapse. Immediate actions include decompression (a1) and maximizing oxygenation (a2). Monitoring tracheal alignment (p1) and breath sounds (p2) validates decompression success.
clinicalPearls: JVD in Tension Pneumothorax results from high intrathoracic pressure hindering blood return to the heart.
Needle decompression occurs in the 2nd intercostal space, mid-clavicular line.
A 'hiss' sound indicates tension release during decompression.

questionTrap.trap: Delaying action to await a Chest X-ray.
questionTrap.howToOvercome: Tension pneumothorax is a clinical diagnosis. Act immediately if tracheal deviation and hypotension are present. Do not delay for imaging.

mnemonic.title: Tension Clues
mnemonic.expansion: S-Shift (Trachea), H-Hyper-resonance, I-Increased JVD, F-Filtered sounds (Absent), T-Tanking BP.
